The Programs
I. INTRODUCTORY PROGRAM. The theme of the series is pre¬
sented in talks by Robert Penn Warren and Claude-Edmonde Magny, with
readings by John Dos Passos, William Faulkner and John Steinbeck. Mod¬
erator. Frederick C. Ellert.
II. THE HENRY JAMES PROGRAM. Critics: W. H. Auden and
R. P. Blackmur. Moderator: G. Stanley Koehler.
III. THE SINCLAIR LEWIS PROGRAM. Critics: Renato Poggioli
and Perry Miller. Moderator: H. Leland Varley.
IV. THE JOHN DOS PASSOS PROGRAM. Critics: Maurice Coin-
dreau and Harry Levin (together with Dos Passos). Moderator: Seymour
Rudin.
V. THE THOMAS WOLFE PROGRAM. Critics: Adolf Klarmann
and Maxwell Geismar. Moderator: Richard C. Savage.
VI. THE ERNEST HEMINGWAY PROGRAM. Critics: Henri
Peyre and Charles Fenton. Moderator: Maxwell H. Goldberg.
VII. THE JOHN STEINBECK PROGRAM. Critics: Edgar Lohner
and Alexander Cowie (together with Steinbeck). Moderator: Robeson Bailey.
VIII. THE WILLIAM FAULKNER PROGRAM. Critics: Rene Gir¬
ard and Carvel Collins. (Faulkner reads selections from his works). Mod¬
erator: Leone Barron.
Narrator: Arthur E. Niedeck
Technical Director: Raymond Wyman
